content: Represents a color as amounts of red, green, and blue (ranging from 0 to 255) that blend together to make a unique color. This class also provides a number of preset colors, like `fuschia`, which can be referenced either by a string value or as one of the constants in this class, e.g. `Color.FUSCHIA`.

name: Color

methods.name: Color(String color)
methods.content: Creates a color from a string name, like `"red"` or `"brown"`. If the name is not recognized, this constructor will throw an `IllegalArgumentException`.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"color","type":"String","required":true,"description":"The name of the color. See the above list for supported color names."}]

methods.name: Color(int red, int green, int blue)
methods.content: Create a new color based on the red, green, and blue values provided. The alpha value will be maximum opacity.
methods.parameters:
[{"name":"red","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the red value from 0 - 255
"},{"name":"green","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the green value from 0 - 255
"},{"name":"blue","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the blue value from 0 - 255
"}]

methods.name: Color(Color color)
methods.content: Creates a new color that a copy of the provided color.

methods.name: getRed()
methods.content: Returns the amount of red (ranging from 0 to 255).

methods.name: getGreen()
methods.content: Returns the amount of green (ranging from 0 to 255).

methods.name: getBlue()
methods.content: Returns the amount of blue (ranging from 0 to 255).

methods.name: setRed(int value)
methods.content: Sets the amount of red (ranging from 0 to 255). Values below 0 will be ignored and set to 0, and values above 255 will be ignored and set to 255.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"value","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the amount of red (ranging from 0 to 255) in the color\n"}]

methods.name: setGreen(int value)
methods.content: Sets the amount of green (ranging from 0 to 255). Values below 0 will be ignored and set to 0, and values above 255 will be ignored and set to 255.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"value","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the amount of green (ranging from 0 to 255) in the color\n"}]

methods.name: setBlue(int value)
methods.parameters: [{"name":"value","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the amount of blue (ranging from 0 to 255) in the color\n"}]
